meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or affecting the nerves.
meanings.sent1: The neuropathic pain in her leg made it difficult to walk.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the neuropathic symptoms were due to nerve damage.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her neuropathic sensitivity to cold made her the perfect ice cream taste tester.
meanings.sent4: His neuropathic fear of failure paralyzed him from taking risks.
meanings.sent5: The neuropathic tingling sensation was like tiny ants crawling on his skin.

meanings.sent1: The neuropathic condition caused numbness in his fingers.
meanings.sent2: Her neuropathic treatment included physical therapy and medication.
meanings.sent3: The neuropathic clumsiness in his movements always led to comical situations.
meanings.sent4: The neuropathic connection between the brain and muscles seemed to be disrupted.
meanings.sent5: The neuropathic tingling feeling was a constant reminder of his condition.

meanings.definition: Caused by or resulting from a disorder of the nervous system.
meanings.sent1: The neuropathic symptoms were a direct result of the nerve disorder.
meanings.sent2: Her neuropathic condition required specialized treatment from a neurologist.
meanings.sent3: The neuropathic mix-up in his brain made him forget his own name.
meanings.sent4: The neuropathic chaos in his thoughts mirrored the disorder in his nervous system.
meanings.sent5: The neuropathic pain shot through his body like lightning strikes.
